social_posts.post_text:
I am happy (and proud) to announce that SecureMySocial, a cybersecurity company that I co-founded with Shira Rubinoff, has been issued its *fifth* United States patent for social media security. The patent was issued by the United States Patent Office on September 6th, 2022, with a priority date going back over a decade, to June of 20112. (Photo is from a prior patent issuance.)

Great meeting Corie Adjmi, who recently released her second book, The Marriage Box, a work of fiction based on her own life story as a girl from New Orleans whose parents decided, when she was 16, to return to their roots, and relocated to the Syrian Jewish community in Brooklyn - in order to marry her off as a teenager.

location.city_name: World Trade Center 9/11 Memorial Site, New York City

social_posts.post_text:
I shall never forget

I commuted through the World Trade Center for much of the early part of my career.

As if it were yesterday, I can still see the faces of the people going into elevators to ascend the North Tower (1 WTC) as I walked past on my commute via the bridge (destroyed on 9/11, and rebuilt as a tunnel) over the street from 6 WTC to the World Financial Center (now known as Brookfield Place).

Less than 9 months before 9/11, I switched to a job in New Jersey ("There but for Fortune go I...") where our office had a clear view of the World Trade Center from further up the Hudson River, and it was from there that I saw the buildings collapse on that terrible Tuesday morning.

People in our office were distraught, and, with cellphone networks failing under overwhelming loads, extremely worried about close relatives known to be downtown at the time. My own father was just a few blocks away when the towers fell.

Our hearts stopped again when, after all airspace was closed, we heard the sound of another plane approaching - growing louder and louder until it sounded like we were going to be hit... you can imagine our relief when we saw an armed fighter jet swoop down quite close to our building and turn to defend Manhattan. 

The next day, still shell-shocked, we held a previously-scheduled strategy meeting with various board members and investors - some of whom were in town from Israel, and were familiar with the widespread trauma felt in the aftermath of terrorist attacks. 

I remained in that same office for several years after 9/11, but, I never enjoyed the view again. In fact, I never again reopened the blinds.

Remembering friends lost, and honoring @FDNY @NYPD @theportauthority_ny_nj @_wtcofficial @usarmy @usnavy @usairforce @usmarinecorp @fortleetodaynj @nycgov @therudygiuliani @governorpataki
With @nirbarkat @rherson 

(Photo is from further south in NJ.)

An appropriate place in Manhattan to stop and reflect, as war rages on between Israel and Hamas.

Hoping for an immediate return of all of the hostages taken by Hamas, for the end of terrorism anywhere and everywhere, for a brighter future for all innocent people in the region, and for an end to the overt anti-Semitsm being repugnantly and fraudulently justified using events unrelated to the innocent people being targeted.

"...and they shall beat their swords into plowshares, and their spears into pruning hooks; nation shall not lift up sword against nation, neither shall they learn war anymore" - Isaiah 2:4

social_posts.post_text:
Custard donuts are one of my favorite foods… they are not, however, a staple of healthy eating… to put it mildly 😊…

Hanukkah, though, gives me an excuse to break my diet and enjoy...

This year, I am also thinking of Roey Weiser, who also loved custard donuts, and who was killed on October 7th while trying to protect innocent people from terrorists.

#NoFilter #donuts #art #nyc #newyork #USA #dessert
